Question.Text: A 29-year-old man presents to a clinic in The Gambia with a 7-day history of skin lesions/rash/itching in his private part. The ulcers are tender, soft and bleed on contact

Answer: Chancroid (Haemophilus ducreyi infection) - The patient presents with painful, tender genital ulcers that bleed easily in The Gambia, endemic for this sexually transmitted infection. The images show multiple deep, soft, ragged-edged ulcers with purulent base and gram-negative bacilli in a 'school of fish' pattern on microscopy, classic findings for chancroid.
